subject: Gardening
title: Mediterranean Polyculture Orchards
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Mediterranean Polyculture Orchards.

hook.text: In southern Europe, olive groves aren't monocultures. Farmers grow vegetables, herbs, and grains between the trees.

buildup.text: Traditional Mediterranean orchards layer olive trees with grapevines, wheat, clover, and herbs in the same space.

discovery.text: The tree canopy provides partial shade that protects understory crops from scorching Mediterranean summers.

twist.text: EU subsidies rewarded olive monoculture, destroying traditional polycultures. Now research is reviving them.

climax.text: Mediterranean polyculture is agroforestry that worked for millenniaâ€”an ancient answer to modern food crises.

punchline.text: Ancient olive groves were the original food forests.

quiz.question: What role do olive tree canopies play in Mediterranean polyculture?
options: They provide partial shade that protects understory crops from extreme summer heat
They drop leaves that poison competing plants underneath
They attract specific pollinators needed by all other crops in the system
